New Records: The Braves became the first MLB team to clinch a 2023 playoff berth with Sunday’s win against the Pittsburgh Pirates.
Spencer Strider recorded his majors-leading 17th win.
The Braves have built the sport’s best record, moving to the top of various polls and power rankings by midseason.
Key Match Events: Spencer Strider had a seven-inning, nine-strikeout outing.
Austin Riley hit a two-run homer in the first inning and added a sacrifice fly in the third.
Kevin Pillar added an RBI double in the fourth.
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves have been not just the class of the division, but arguably of the NL and all of baseball, building the sport’s best record.
Post-Match Reflections: The Braves would have to win a division series and NLCS before they could try to win a second World Series title in three years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves improved to 96-50 on the season — the best record in the majors — and leads second-place Philadelphia by 17 games in the division.
The Braves clinched in their 146th game, the second-earliest date for the Braves to clinch since the divisional era began in 1969.
Others: The Phillies play better at Citizens Bank Park and believe there is a real advantage to having that first series here.
The Phillies need to win some games to make that happen.
